Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Okay, lets tackle this problem step by step. The goal is to create an event log from the given tables for process mining. First, I need to understand each table and how they relate to each other.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with the Orders table, it has order details like creation date and sales person. Each order_id is unique, so that will be our Case ID.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Next, the Order Lines table shows items picked per order. Theres a picking date for each item, which I can use as an activity timestamp. The picker_id tells me who did the picking, so thats the Resource/Actor here.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The Delivery table has dispatch and arrival dates for deliveries. Each delivery is linked to an order_id. If there are multiple deliveries for one order (like order 1002), each should be a separate event with its own timestamps.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Invoices are issued after items are picked and delivered. The Invoice table includes issue dates, which will be the activity timestamp for Invoice Issued. Similarly, payments are made against invoices, so Ill link those to their respective invoices using payment_date as the timestamp.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I need to ensure that each event is ordered chronologically. For example, an orders creation should come before any picking activities, and picking should happen before dispatching a delivery.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: For cases with multiple deliveries or invoices, like order 1002, Ill have to generate separate events for each. Also, if there are partial deliveries (like DLV-5003 for order 1002), they need individual entries.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Resources from the Resources table can be used to map IDs to actual names and roles, making the log more readable.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Now, lets start building the event log by iterating through each table, extracting relevant data, and linking them using order_id as the key. Ill make sure all activities are in sequence and include necessary resources where available.
